props.title: Part A: Spelling
props.instructions: Read each sentence carefully. Write the missing word in the space provided. Make sure you spell the word correctly.

props.question: The archaeologist made an important __________ in the ancient tomb.
Her __________ to become a marine biologist never wavered.
The weather forecast predicted __________ rain throughout the weekend.
The students showed great __________ when organising the charity event.
The athlete's performance was __________ by anyone's standards.
We need to __________ our plans before the deadline.
The documentary provided a __________ account of the historical events.
The medicine helped to __________ the patient's symptoms.
The magician's tricks created an __________ of floating objects.
The company aims to __________ customer satisfaction above all else.
The twins showed a __________ resemblance to each other.
Regular exercise can __________ your overall health.
The referee made a __________ decision that upset both teams.
The museum displayed __________ artefacts from ancient civilisations.
The architect designed a __________ building for the city centre.
We must __________ the situation before making any decisions.
The principal gave __________ for the excursion to proceed.
The scientist's theory was based on __________ evidence.
The committee will __________ the new policies next month.
The lawyer presented a __________ argument in court.
The council plans to __________ the old playground equipment.
His __________ attitude helped him overcome many obstacles.
The chef used __________ ingredients to create the perfect dish.
The government announced a new __________ to reduce carbon emissions.
The singer's __________ voice captivated the audience.

props.title: Part B: Grammar and Punctuation
props.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question. Select A, B, C, or D.

props.question: Which sentence is punctuated correctly?
options: The students finished their homework, then they went outside to play.
The students finished their homework then, they went outside to play.
The students, finished their homework then they went outside to play.
The students finished their homework then they went outside, to play.

props.question: Identify the adjective in this sentence: The enormous elephant trumpeted loudly.
options: elephant
enormous
trumpeted
loudly

props.question: Which sentence uses apostrophes correctly?
options: The dog's were playing in the park.
The dogs' toys were scattered everywhere.
The dog's toy's were broken.
The dogs toy's needed replacing.

props.question: Which word is an adverb in this sentence: She quickly ran across the field.
options: she
quickly
ran
field

props.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: Me and my friend went to the cinema.
My friend and me went to the cinema.
My friend and I went to the cinema.
I and my friend went to the cinema.

props.question: Where should the comma be placed? Before the concert began the musicians tuned their instruments.
options: Before the concert, began the musicians tuned their instruments.
Before the concert began, the musicians tuned their instruments.
Before the, concert began the musicians tuned their instruments.
Before the concert began the musicians, tuned their instruments.

props.question: Which sentence contains a verb in the past tense?
options: The cat is sleeping on the couch.
The cat sleeps on the couch every day.
The cat will sleep on the couch later.
The cat slept on the couch yesterday.

props.question: Which sentence uses quotation marks correctly?
options: "Where are you going? asked Tom."
Where are you going? "asked Tom."
"Where are you going?" asked Tom.
"Where are you going" asked Tom?

props.question: Identify the noun phrase in this sentence: The tall girl with brown hair won the race.
options: tall girl
The tall girl with brown hair
won the race
with brown hair

props.question: Which sentence uses a semicolon correctly?
options: I love reading; books take me to different worlds.
I love; reading books take me to different worlds.
I love reading books; take me to different worlds.
I; love reading books take me to different worlds.

props.question: Which word best completes this sentence? Neither the teacher _____ the students knew the answer.
options: or
nor
and
but

props.question: Which sentence is a compound sentence?
options: The rain poured down heavily all afternoon.
Although it was raining, we went outside.
It was raining heavily, so we stayed inside.
We stayed inside because of the heavy rain.

props.question: Which sentence uses 'their', 'there', or 'they're' correctly?
options: Their going to the beach tomorrow.
The students put there books on the desk.
They're planning a surprise party for their friend.
There coming to visit us next week.

props.question: Identify the preposition in this sentence: The book is under the table.
options: book
is
under
table

props.question: Which sentence contains correct subject-verb agreement?
options: The group of students are going on an excursion.
The group of students is going on an excursion.
The group of students were going on an excursion.
The group of students have going on an excursion.

props.question: Which word in this sentence is a conjunction? I wanted to go swimming, but the pool was closed.
options: to
swimming
but
was

props.question: Which sentence uses a colon correctly?
options: For the recipe you will need: flour, eggs, milk, and sugar.
For the recipe: you will need flour, eggs, milk, and sugar.
For the recipe you will need flour: eggs, milk, and sugar.
For: the recipe you will need flour, eggs, milk, and sugar.

props.question: Which is the best way to combine these sentences? The dog barked. The cat ran away.
options: The dog barked, the cat ran away.
The dog barked and the cat ran away.
The dog barked, so the cat ran away.
The dog barked the cat ran away.

props.question: Which sentence is written in the passive voice?
options: The chef prepared a delicious meal.
A delicious meal was prepared by the chef.
The chef is preparing a delicious meal.
The chef will prepare a delicious meal.

props.question: Which sentence uses 'its' or 'it's' correctly?
options: The dog wagged it's tail happily.
Its going to rain this afternoon.
The tree lost its leaves in autumn.
The committee made it's decision yesterday.

props.question: Identify the pronoun in this sentence: We enjoyed ourselves at the party.
options: We
enjoyed
party
at

props.question: Which sentence contains an error?
options: She walks to school every morning.
They was playing football in the park.
The students are reading their books quietly.
My brother has finished his homework.

props.question: Which sentence uses commas correctly in a list?
options: We bought apples, oranges, bananas and grapes.
We bought apples oranges, bananas, and grapes.
We bought, apples, oranges, bananas, and grapes.
We bought apples, oranges, bananas, and grapes.

props.question: Which word is a proper noun?
options: city
Sydney
building
school

props.question: Which sentence is a complex sentence?
options: I ate lunch and then went for a walk.
When I arrived home, I started my homework.
She likes reading, and he enjoys sports.
The weather was perfect for a picnic.

props.question: Which sentence uses 'affect' or 'effect' correctly?
options: The weather will effect our plans.
What affect did the news have on you?
The medicine had a positive effect on her health.
How will this affect to the outcome?

props.question: Identify the article in this sentence: A small bird landed on the branch.
options: small
bird
A
on

props.question: Which sentence uses consistent verb tense?
options: Yesterday, I walk to school and see my friend.
Yesterday, I walked to school and saw my friend.
Yesterday, I walked to school and see my friend.
Yesterday, I will walk to school and saw my friend.

props.question: Which sentence needs a question mark?
options: I wonder what time it is
She asked me to help her
What time does the movie start
He told me where to go

props.question: Which sentence contains a comparative adjective?
options: This is the tallest building in the city.
She is taller than her sister.
He is a tall person.
They are very tall.

props.question: Which sentence uses 'who' or 'whom' correctly?
options: Who did you give the book to?
To who did you give the book?
Whom is coming to the party?
Who are you looking for?

props.question: Which sentence contains a dangling modifier?
options: Walking down the street, the trees looked beautiful.
Walking down the street, I admired the beautiful trees.
The trees looked beautiful as I walked down the street.
I walked down the street admiring the beautiful trees.

props.question: Which sentence uses parallel structure correctly?
options: She enjoys swimming, to run, and cycling.
She enjoys swimming, running, and to cycle.
She enjoys swimming, running, and cycling.
She enjoys to swim, running, and cycling.

props.question: Which word is an interjection?
options: Wow, that was amazing!
The race was exciting.
She ran quickly.
They cheered loudly.

props.question: Which sentence uses 'fewer' or 'less' correctly?
options: There were less people at the concert than expected.
I have less homework than you.
There are fewer students in this class.
She drinks less glasses of water than recommended.
